company_overview: Data Scientist - Staff                    Lockheed Martin                                  White Sands, NM                               4 weeks ago                                    1 applicant                    Full-time · Entry level10,001+ employees · Defense and Space Manufacturing267 school alumniSee recent hiring trends for Lockheed Martin Corporation. Try Premium for free Your profile matches this job     Apply         Save            Save Data Scientist - Staff at Lockheed Martin
Title: Data Scientist - Staff
JD:
About the job
    


          The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.
 The Double Eagle II contract recently increased its scope to begin defining and utilizing Data Science and Data Visualization practices to optimize and reinvigorate how multiple data sets are analyzed. We are looking for a data scientist to grow our existing automation efforts by enhancing our data analysis and data architecture practices. You will support a satellite operations contract where the field of data science is being developed from the ground up. You will become one of the first Data Scientists on the contract in order to define new data CONOPS, develop/automate optimized data flows, and utilize Data Science practices in order to revolutionize how the contract operates. You can expect to be involved in Enterprise outreach and defining requirements to use and analyze data for multiple mission partners and contract leadership. Candidate will be highly involved with product development. You will establish working data sets, configurations, and profiles in support of metric analysis. You will apply complex analysis of data in support of mission problems, with expertise in problem solving, scripting in multiple languages, as well as the creation and/or implementation of tools and processes that aid in advanced analytics, testing and quality assurance, and DevOps. Leverage automation and machine learning to manage data, predict scenarios and make recommendations. Contribute to building new analytical tools and packages across the enterprise and will be expected to collaborate with team members in a highly technical environment. You may perform outreach to potential new customers to educate them on our available products and how we can leverage our offerings to increase efficiency within their teams.
Typically has 5 - 10 years of professional experience.
To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking.
Here Are Some Of The Benefits You Can Enjoy
Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually.
 Medical Dental 401k Paid time off Work/life balance Career development Mentorship opportunities Rewards & recognition

Title: Data Scientist
JD:
About the job
    


          The coolest jobs on this planet… or any other… are with Lockheed Martin Space.
At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator, and builder. Our amazing people are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture encourages employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.
Do you want to be part of a company that inspires employees to think big, perform with excellence and build incredible products? If so, then we would love to speak with you! Lockheed Martin Space is a highly dynamic and growing organization that provides mission-critical solutions from the development and maintenance of satellite systems through their life cycle.
Our amazing employees are on a mission to make a difference in the world; every single day we use our ingenuity and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems.
The Enterprise Operations Analysis (EOA) team is searching for a high energy individual with a strong background in astrodynamics, satellite operations, and/or Space Domain Awareness. The selected candidate will lead modeling, simulation, and analysis studies that provide data driven insights to leaders across multiple Lines of Business within Lockheed Martin Space, helping shape their strategies to meet customer needs.
Your Responsibilities Will Include The Following
 Lead and perform studies to model and analyze ground-based and space-based sensing performance and trades of space targets (e.g. collection, resource allocation, access, gaps, etc.) Regularly engage with internal and external stakeholders to understand their analysis needs, plan analysis tasks, and lead small teams to deliver valuable findings to stakeholders Present findings to key stakeholders assessing enterprise performance under a variety of configuration options to drive decision making Help various programs establish Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs) for space protection.

company_overview: Data Scientist                    Lockheed Martin                                  Bethesda, MD              On-site                1 month ago                                    10 applicants                    Full-time · Entry level10,001+ employees · Defense and Space Manufacturing267 school alumniSee how you compare to 10 applicants. Try Premium for free Your profile matches this job     Apply         Save            Save Data Scientist at Lockheed Martin
Title: Data Scientist
JD:
About the job
    


          Perform exploratory research and analysis to identify novel and meaningful patterns in data and uses statistical methods to reject or accept proposed hypotheses about relationships or latent predictive factors discovered through their work to provide business value.
Uses a combination of tools, technologies, and numerical computing systems (i.e.: GPU processing, distributed computing, highly parallel coding, cloud computing, machine learning, visualization, system modelling and simulation) to achieve results.
Areas of expertise should include several of the following: applied statistics, text mining, natural language processing, deep learning, optimization, and other similar fields.
Work on datasets with applied statistics and machine learning algorithms; Use exploratory data analysis techniques to identify meaningful relationships, patterns, or trends from complex data sets and discover opportunities in datasets to support decision-making; Develop predictive models and new algorithms to solve data / business problems; Understand the math and statistics behind the models and interpret, extrapolate, and prescribe from data to deliver actionable recommendations using effective visualizations

company_overview: Data Scientist (Skill Level 2)                    Lockheed Martin                                  Annapolis Junction, MD                               1 week ago                                    1 applicant                    Full-time · Entry level10,001+ employees · Defense and Space Manufacturing267 school alumniSee recent hiring trends for Lockheed Martin Corporation. Try Premium for free Your profile matches this job     Apply         Save            Save Data Scientist (Skill Level 2) at Lockheed Martin
Title: Data Scientist (Skill Level 2)
JD:
About the job
    


          Sensor Tradecraft Optimization (STO) enables our organization to align with CSD priorities. STO is an end-to-end agnostic solution provider that analyzes sensor data, designs, and delivers automated solutions to optimize sensor collection. STO architects and engineer’s tradecraft threads to drive sensors to produce the highest value data and threat intelligences to improve the Nation’s cybersecurity posture.
TKO is seeking Data Scientists to support the Cyber Threat Intelligence initiative to support defense of our nation’s most critical unclassified and classified networks. The individual will interpret and manipulate data, analyze data sets, creates reports and data visualizations.
Tasking Will Consist Of The Following
 Produce data visualizations that provide insight into dataset structure and meaning Work with subject matters experts (SMEs) to identify important information in raw data and develop scripts that extract this information from a variety of data formats (e.g., SQL tables, structured metadata, network logs) Incorporate SME input into feature vectors suitable for analytic development and testingTranslate customer qualitative analysis process and goals into quantitative formulations that are coded into software prototypes Develop and implement statistical, machine learning, and heuristic techniques to create descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics Develop statistical tests to make data-driven recommendations and decisions Develop experiments to collect data or models to simulate data when required data are unavailable Develop feature vectors for input into machine learning algorithms Identify the most appropriate algorithm for a given dataset and tune input and model parameters Evaluate and validate the performance of analytics using standard techniques and metrics (e.g. cross validation, ROC curves, confusion matrices)

company_overview: AI/ML Data Scientist - Electronics Warfare (EW)                    Lockheed Martin                                  Liverpool, NY              On-site                3 weeks ago               Full-time · Entry level10,001+ employees · Defense and Space Manufacturing267 school alumniSee recent hiring trends for Lockheed Martin Corporation. Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save AI/ML Data Scientist - Electronics Warfare (EW) at Lockheed Martin
Title: AI/ML Data Scientist - Electronics Warfare (EW)
JD:
About the job
    


          At Lockheed Martin, we believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. We value your unique skills and expertise, and we aim to give back continuously by offering a wide variety of benefits and amenities to help our employees live flexible, balanced, and fulfilling lives at, and outside of, work.
Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems has an opportunity for an early career AI/ML Engineer supporting the Electronic Warfare (EW) program area. As an early career hire on our Engineering team, you can help us take on the world’s most important and complex challenges by providing solutions to a variety of technical problems of moderate scope and complexity under general supervision. In this important role, you will collaborate with a diverse team of technical professionals and interact with outside customers. The successful candidate will be flexible, motivated, dedicated, detail-focused, team-oriented, and capable of multi-tasking.
Position Responsibilities performed to complete milestones associated with specific projects:
 Translate requirements and apply to developing, implementing, and deploying autonomy and artificial intelligence algorithms for LM products and platforms; Implements algorithms to train systems to recognize patterns and perform specific functions; Responsible for various phases of developing, testing, troubleshooting and maintaining autonomy software. Develops human-machine interface scenarios, breaking missions into tasks;

Lockheed Martin offers a wide range of benefits to fit your needs such as 401K, PTO, and work/life balance.
